OmeroScreen Plots
  • Utility Functions
  • Edit on GitHub

Utility Functions

This module provides utility functions used across the plotting package.

Functions

omero_screen_plots.utils.save_fig(fig: Figure, path: Path, fig_id: str, tight_layout: bool = False, fig_extension: str = 'pdf', resolution: int = 300) → None[source]

Save a matplotlib figure to a file.

Return type:

None

Parameters

figFigure

The figure to save.

pathPath

The path for saving the figure.

fig_idstr

The name of the saved figure.

tight_layoutbool, optional

Whether to use tight layout (default is True).

fig_extensionstr, optional

The file extension for the saved figure (default is ‘pdf’).

resolutionint, optional

The resolution of the saved figure in dpi (default is 300).

Returns:

None

Saves the figure in the specified format.

omero_screen_plots.utils.scale_data(df: DataFrame, scale_col: str, scale_min: float = 1.0, scale_max: float = 99.0) → DataFrame[source]

Scale data in the dataframe by the specified column.

Return type:

DataFrame

omero_screen_plots.utils.selector_val_filter(df: DataFrame, selector_col: str | None, selector_val: str | None, condition_col: str | None, conditions: list[str] | None) → DataFrame | None[source]

Check if selector_val is provided for selector_col and filter df.

Return type:

Optional[DataFrame]

omero_screen_plots.utils.get_repeat_points(df: DataFrame, condition_col: str, y_col: str) → DataFrame[source]

Get repeat points for the given condition and y column.

Return type:

DataFrame

omero_screen_plots.utils.show_repeat_points(df: DataFrame, conditions: list[str], condition_col: str, y_col: str, ax: Axes) → None[source]

Show repeat points.

Return type:

None

omero_screen_plots.utils.select_datapoints(df: DataFrame, conditions: list[str], condition_col: str, n: int = 30) → DataFrame[source]

Select up to n random datapoints per category and plate-id.

Return type:

DataFrame

omero_screen_plots.utils.grouped_x_positions(n_conditions: int, group_size: int = 2, bar_width: float = 0.5, within_group_spacing: float = 0.5, between_group_gap: float = 1.0) → list[float][source]

Generate x-axis positions for grouped plots.

Parameters: - n_conditions: number of conditions (bars/groups) - group_size: number of conditions per group - bar_width: width of each bar - within_group_spacing: space between conditions in a group (distance between bar edges) - between_group_gap: extra space between groups (distance between bar edges) Returns a list of x positions for each condition (bar center).

Return type:

list[float]

Examples

Scaling immunofluorescence data:

from omero_screen_plots.utils import scale_data
import pandas as pd

# Scale intensity data to 16-bit range
df = pd.read_csv("data.csv")
df_scaled = scale_data(
    df,
    scale_col="intensity_mean_p21_nucleus",
    scale_min=1.0,  # 1st percentile
    scale_max=99.0  # 99th percentile
)

Saving figures with consistent formatting:

from omero_screen_plots.utils import save_fig
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

fig, ax = plt.subplots()
# ... create your plot ...

save_fig(
    fig=fig,
    path=Path("output"),
    fig_id="my_analysis",
    fig_extension="pdf",
    resolution=300
)

Filtering data by condition:

from omero_screen_plots.utils import selector_val_filter

# Filter for specific experimental condition
filtered_df = selector_val_filter(
    df=data,
    selector_col="cell_line",
    selector_val="HeLa",
    condition_col="treatment",
    conditions=["DMSO", "Nutlin"]
)
